title: 113_hr4195
content: The Act titled "Federal Register Modernization Act" aims to modernize the Federal Register. The Act "Federal Register Modernization Act" amends Chapter 15 of title 44, United States Code, by changing references from "printing" to "publishing" and updating terminology related to document distribution to reflect modern practices. The Act "Federal Register Modernization Act" updates terminology in Chapter 15 of title 44, United States Code, including defining "publish" as circulating for sale or distribution to the public and specifying the filing of documents with the Office of the Federal Register for publication. Upon filing, documents are available for public inspection in the Office. The original documents are retained by the National Archives and Records Administration, unless disposed of according to regulations. Proclamations of the President and Executive orders are permanently kept as part of the National Archives. The Office sends each document required for publication to the Government Printing Office. Federal agencies must transmit all documents issued to be published by section 1505 of title 44. The Government Printing Office publishes these documents in the 'Federal Register' promptly as required by regulations. The daily issues of the Federal Register contain all documents authorized for publication. Documents required or authorized for publication must be filed with the Office of the Federal Register. Each document must include a notation of the day and hour it was made available for public inspection. Prices for the Federal Register can be set by the Administrative Committee without restrictions on government publication sales. Section 1505 of title 44, United States Code is amended to change "comments" to "news commentary" and include "telecommunications, the Internet," in subsection (c). Section 1506 is amended to read as follows: "Sec. 1506. Administrative Committee of the Federal Register." The Administrative Committee of the Federal Register consists of the Archivist of the United States, an officer of the Department of Justice designated by the Attorney General, and the Public Printer. The committee prescribes regulations for publishing documents in the Federal Register, including the manner of publication and distribution to Members of Congress. The Administrative Committee of the Federal Register prescribes regulations for publishing and distributing documents, including details on distribution to Members of Congress, pricing, receiving public comments, and special editions. Section 1510 of title 44, United States Code, is amended to address the Code of Federal Regulations. The Administrative Committee of the Federal Register, with the President's approval, may require the preparation and publication of a complete codification of agency documents with legal effect. This codification, designated as the 'Code of Federal Regulations', will be regulated by the Administrative Committee. The Administrative Committee regulates the publication of the codification, including supplementation, collation, and republication to keep it current. The Office of the Federal Register prepares and publishes the codifications, supplements, collations, and user aids as authorized. The Administrative Committee, with approval of the President, shall issue regulations for carrying out the codification, supplementation, collation, and republication of documents in the Code of Federal Regulations. Presidential documents are exempt from this codification requirement. Technical and Conforming Amendments are made to the table of sections for chapter 15 of title 44, United States Code. Chapter 15 of title 44, United States Code, is amended by replacing items related to sections 1502, 1503, and 1504 with new provisions. Chapter 15 of title 44, United States Code, is amended by replacing items related to sections 1502, 1503, and 1504 with new provisions regarding custody, publishing, filing, public inspection, and distribution of Federal documents. The House of Representatives passed the amendments on July 14, 2014.
